author: viktormux
title: TRANSPORT & LOGISITCS DAO
description: Small/Medium sized Transport & Logistic Companies will struggle to upgrade their managing systems to implement DLT and AI.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem statement focuses on making a provision for DAO (Decentralized Autonomous Organization) for small scale transport and logisic sector to have DLT and AI adapted into their ecosystem but the solution provided doesn't shine light on how cardano DAO in specific can actually help reoslving the issue that exists for the same sectors to adapt. A little more details on hoe the solution would be implemented and exposed to the sector would have been great info for this purpose.
f6_assessments.q1: The individual proposer holds relevant experience as far as the transport and logistics is concerned due to his/her number of years turned experience in the domain but a little more exposure to blockchain/cardano in specific would have been great in order to persue the proposal to make it to the end without bottlenecks with a better designed phases and timeline.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal gives an overview of the Idea to develop an ecosystem for the mentioned sector in haigh level but it would have been great to have a detailed plan of execution along with timeline for the same. Also despite being small amount of fund requested it would have been great if a breakdown of the same would have been provided in order to audit the success in phases for the same

f6_assessments.q0: Building a DAO to encourage and help businesses in the transport and logistics sector implement their systems on the Cardano blockchain, could potentially greatly expand the user base of Cardano. It would also attract other companies or projects to build, based on the potential succes of such a proposal. What is not clear, as a lack of a plan description, is why this would be better served through a DAO and not a company.
f6_assessments.q1: While the proposer claims to have been working in this field for several years and has linked to his company website, the lack of any other plan details are an impediment in evaluating the proposal. Saying that you count on the Cardano developer and advising community is not enough,  not for a proposal that should be assessed, nor as a call to action to other community members. Community members will come forward to help if they believe in your project, but to do that, they first need all the details.
f6_assessments.q2: As is stands now, the proposal is not in a final draft, it lacks any detailed parameters that would help in its evaluation: detailed plan, team members necessary, KPIs, detailed budget. I highly suggest a resubmission in a future fund with all the needed data.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a draft proposal. Relevant information about the impact of this proposal is missing. This proposal is not executable nor does it provide information on how this idea will create value to the Cardano Ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer doesn't provide relevant information on how to implement this idea. The idea is not clear described. A plan is missing. Also we don't find any information about the proposer.
f6_assessments.q2: No info has been provided to show how this project will solve the problems it wants to solve. There is no way to track the progress or success of this project.

f6_assessments.q0:
I think I am competent to assess this proposal as I have been active in project Catalyst since fund 4 and I have experience analyzing business requirements from over 5 years of delivering software solutions for small business and corporations as well.
The problem statement is clearly formulated, but it does not mention why Transport & Logistics companies should want to upgrade their systems to Distributed Ledger Technologies and Artificial Intelligence. Perhaps you are referring only to very large companies, which would stand to gain from these new technologies - I fail to see how this would help a small local transportation business. Also, when using acronyms, especially from the blockchain / tech space, try to explain what they mean below, or to reiterate your problem statement later on so that non-technical people too (which will be the majority of voters), can understand what you want to say.
The solution sounds clear to me as well, but like the problem statement, it suffers from not explaining why these companies need this upgrade and how it would help them. Unfortunately, I did not find this information in the detailed plan either, only a statement expanding on what the DAO would do, in general terms ("educate and incentivize the adoption of new technologies, promote efficiency and good practices"). This all sounds great, but the proposal needs to explain how the DAO would do this, or give examples of how success here looks like. With the information above missing, unfortunately I strongly disagree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge, as it fails to specify concretely how the DAO will operate and how the proposal aims to set it up. Additionally, please consider adding KPI's and a concrete step by step plan in the future, as these are mandatory for a good proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has only mentioned that they have been operating since 2005 at CargoNetwork, a Transport & Logistic solutions company in Europe, but they have not mentioned in what capacity. No information is given either about a team or who the people with the necessary tech skills to build these products are. Is it an internal team of the company? Please note that it is necessary to add credentials which specify this information, so that ADA holders can understand who will be working on this.
Due to the missing information that I mentioned above, as well as no breakdown of the budget or details on how it will be allocated, no risk analysis and no plan outlining the technical approach, I have to disagree that this proposal can be implemented successfully. Please note that this is all crucial information that you need to add to a proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: I strongly disagree that the information here is sufficient for this proposal to be auditable, or clear to understand. It needs to clarify what it wants to do and it needs a roadmap of how it will do it, as well as KPI's to help track its progress.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal addresses the main objectives of the challenge, by proposing DAO for the Transport & Logistics sector, to encourage and facilitate these companies to implement DLT in their systems. The problem statement about Small/Medium sized Transport & Logistic Companies struggle to upgrade their managing systems to implement DLT and AI is a real world issue. Although the problem statement and solution are both relevant to the challenge, the proposal does not give good explanation on how a DAO can be the solution to the problem. To improve the proposal, team should provide more details on the problem and its proposed solution and explain the link between solution offered and problem statement.
f6_assessments.q1: As an industry expert and business owner, proposer have relevant experience that could boost the likelihood of project success. However, he didn't provide details about how to execute the project. The team requested a budget without detail on how the money will be spend or allocated. There is no roadmap, budget breakdown, or timeline for the execution of this project in the proposal. My suggestion for the team is to complete the proposal with more information and details.
f6_assessments.q2: There are no clear success metrics or KPI in the proposal. The team does not provide deliverables, roadmap, or detailed plan on how to execute the project and there is no budget breakdown in the proposal. Team does not mention where they will publish the progress of project execution making it difficult to trace, monitor, or audit the project. My suggestion for the team is to update the proposal with more information and details including deliverables, goals, KPI, roadmap, detailed execution plan, and budget breakdown.

f6_assessments.q0: Applying Cardano's Blockchain to Transport & Logistics is a very practical application that Cardano is looking forward to in the future. Because the application in Transport & Logistics is a very necessary application and can be fully applied by the smart contract of the blockchain. I really like this idea. But I'd rather see a concrete plan than an idea. Proposer does not clearly present products and solutions. Therefore, it is difficult to see the impact of the proposal
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has been operating since 2005 at CargoNetwork, a trusted Transport & Logistic solutions company providing solutions in the european market. This experience is very suitable for the implementation of this proposal. But for the proposal to be successful, I think the team needs people who are capable of blockchain programming as well as smart contracts to implement the proposal. The proposer's experience in the Transport & Logistics industry is not enough.
Besides, the proposal still does not have a specific plan and solution. Therefore, I do not think the feasibility of this proposal is high
f6_assessments.q2: there is no relevant information provided that would make it possible to audit the proposed idea - there are also no measurements of success and the problem statement and the offered solution are unclear, it is not even clear if this team is even planning to implement their project on the Cardano network or not?

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal focuses on creating a DAO [for the Transport & Logistics sector, to encourage and facilitate these companies to implement DLT in their systems. This is a great idea but it seems that this proposal is not completed. I think it has a certain fit for the challenge and the transport & logistics sector. In case this proposal needs to be completed in the future, the proposer should pay attention to: (1) Clarifying the plan of "retribute development"; and (2) What are expected advising services ?. Based on the given information, I can not agree with this proposal's impact and would give it a score of 2.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal comes from a Logistics-related organization - CargoNetwork. From the perspective of logistics, the potential idea's feasibility can be seen, however, in terms of DAO technology, I am not convinced. As mentioned, this is a great idea (integrating DAO into Logistics). However, it's not easy to evaluate how feasible an incomplete proposal would be. Therefore, definitely, there is no ground to agree on the feasibility of this proposal, however, I think this team should focus on finding a partner in the DAO technology sector for completing this idea [with (i) Goals and target; (2) road map (integrated with measurable KPIs/metrics); (3) Budget breakdown; (4) Risk and challenge] Based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's feasibility and would give it a score of 2.
f6_assessments.q2: Since this proposal is incomplete, auditability can not be guaranteed. Therefore, based on the given information, I strongly disagree with this proposal's auditability and would give it a score of 1.

f6_assessments.q0: The problem is real and statement is aligned with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The general idea is very good and there is a proven track record in logistics and transport field, but unfortunately the actual solution/plan is not sufficiently presented in the proposal and no blockchain experience is included or clearly indicated in the team.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal highlights the plan to "encourage" and "facilitate", but there is not sufficient information to audit the progress present in the proposal.

solution: Let's create a DAO for the Transport & Logistics sector, to encourage and facilitate these companies to implement DLT in their systems.
experience: I've been operating since 2005 at CargoNetwork, a trusted Transport & Logistic solutions company providing solutions in the european market.
